website_summaries.verdict: The Merrell Moab Edge is an amazingly comfortable, low-cut day hiking shoe that has top-notch durability, arch support and traction. It is a true-to-size piece of hiking gear that’s exceedingly lightweight and breathable. Many people gave this footwear much praise for its versatility and almost non-existent break-in time. Some users, however, didn’t appreciate the roominess of the toe box and heel zone, with the latter blamed for causing heel slippage. The flimsy stitching of the lace loops was also mocked by a very few.
pros: A large percentage of users felt like they were walking on clouds with the Moab Edge’s high level of comfort
Many avid Merrell fans admired this hiker’s dependable arch support
This low-cut hiking shoe left dozens of wearers speechless for providing them a true-to-size fit
A multitude of satisfied owners applauded the shoe’s lasting durability
The Moab Edge has excellent traction on uneven terrain and wet rocks, according to many passionate hikers
Quite a number of people fell instantly in love with the shoe’s unbelievable lightness
Merrell’s Moab Edge received heaps of praises from some users for its fantastic breathability

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.  Usually far better made.
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable to wear, but have not lasted very long. As usual with Merrell shoes, I need to go up a full size (I'm size UK 11 for most shoe brands but normally need size UK 12 for Merrell shoes). The upper of both shoes are now splitting in multiple places on both shoes (see photos) and I have not really worn them that much... see the lack of wear on the sole. I normally really like Merrell shoes but I am left very disappointed here.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D

customer_reviews.title: 10/10.  6th pair... please keep making them for ever!
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these when they have been on offer for 2 years now. Incredible shoe. I walk 5-10 hours a day and have no pain in these. After 3 months the tread starts to thin and the comfort starts to fade a little. But they are still wearable for another 3 before tears start to form. What would really help is the ability to buy the insoles. They degrade before the shoe looks like a hobo's. Replacing insoles when the inside of the shoe is so perfectly contoured is harder than you would think.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Lutton

customer_reviews.title: They look better than the photo (less plasticky) but broke the first ...
customer_reviews.text: They look better than the photo (less plasticky) but broke the first time I put them on. The laces fixings comes away from one shoe in two places. The loops has not been sewn to the shoe correctly. Went to try my luck with another pair but now £24 more!
customer_reviews.author: Acer99

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort for fraction of RRP.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes at fantastic price. Have to say that unlike another reviewer, I actually take a half size smaller in Merrell as I think they are a large-make brand. Normally a Size 9 UK, EUR 43......in Merrell a EUR 43 is size 8.5 UK.
customer_reviews.author: Cantare cum ecclesia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought these for me for Christmas, I was skeptical at first as a previous purchase from the same manufacturer was a little small. They're amazingly comfortable and lightweight. My only grouse is the fact that the sole is so thick, that when driving with them on, the pedals feel like there's a block of wood between them :) Brilliant otherwise!
customer_reviews.author: Melroy, London

customer_reviews.title: Merrill Moab Hiking Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Had to go for size 12, like other shoes I have purchased recently. These, however did not look over long in appearance and fit really well, as I have a high instep. Very comfortable, even when I have been on my feet all day. Pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, but buy up a half a size!
customer_reviews.text: Great trainers. Just watch the sizing. Merrels are always half a size too small for myself, and other buyers seem to concur.
customer_reviews.author: Simon W.

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable to walk around in and a good fit although ...
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable to walk around in and a good fit although I did take other peoples advise and order a size bigger than I normally would have.
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: unsatisfactory
customer_reviews.text: too tight and inferior to pair bought several years ago which looked identical. Won't buy footrear by mail order again
customer_reviews.author: maureen sheron

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ordered size 9 usual for Addidas trainers, but re order 9 1/2 much better
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic shoe, light, good arch support and heel impact cushioning.  Cant sing their praises enough
customer_reviews.text: Best shoes i have ever bought. I have now ordered 3 more just incase they stop selling them ^^ I walk 6-10 hours a day. My feet don't even feel that bad after 10 hours. Some other shoes I have my feet feel worse after 3 hours than 10 in these. They are as durable as you could expect. After 3 months the tread looks thin, and the padding does not provide the same comfort. but i still managed to get another month and bit out of them. I replaced the insole after 3 months, which increased comfort but kind of ruined the nice arch support. 5/5 highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Lutton

customer_reviews.title: My curiosity led me to purchase a pair and I can say that they seem to be of good quality and are comfortable from the box
customer_reviews.text: Was quite surprised to find a Merrell Hiking shoe at such a reasonable price. My curiosity led me to purchase a pair and I can say that they seem to be of good quality and are comfortable from the box. Only time will tell the durability, but as I don't foresee excessively hard wear on these shoes, only town walking, they should last for quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Peter S Bedford

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Moab Edge Low Rise Hiking Shoes
product_meta.description: These moab edge shoes from merrell feature mesh and 3d printed mesh upper and breathable mesh lining. They also feature bellows tongue that keeps out debris, molded nylon arch shank and vibram tc5+ outsole. They have merrell m select fit.eco blended eva contoured foot bed with organic odour control and merrell air cushion in the heel absorbs shock.
feature_bullets: Bellows Tongue Cover - Prevents mud and debris from getting inside the shoe.
Synthetic Leather Toe/Heel-Caps - Protects the toe/heel in mountains or trail environments.
Merrell M Select FIT.ECO blended EVA contoured footbed - Provides the optimal control with organic odour control.
Merrell Air Cushion - Located in the heel to absorb shock and add stability.
Moulded Nylon Arch Shank - A rigid material in the shank region of the midsole keeps the foot in a neutral position throughout the midstance phase of the gait cycle.
